topic: V1 た-form とおりに, V2
explanations: This indicates doing V2 by the same method or under the same conditions as V1.
examples: 1) 私[わたし]が やった とおりに，やって ください。
2) 見[み]た とおりに， 話[はな]して ください。
2) Please describe exactly what you saw

explanations: This indicates performing an action without deviating from the standard indicated by the preceding phrase
examples: 1) 線[せん]の とおりに，紙[かみ]を 切[き]って ください。
1) Please cut the paper along the line
2) 説明書[せつめいしょ]の とおりに，組[く]み立[た]てました
2) I assembled it in accordance with the instructions

forms: V1 た-form あとで, V2
Noun の あとで, V2
explanations: This indicates that the action denoted by V2 happens after the action or situation denoted by V1 or Noun
[Note] This puts more emphasis on the time context in which the events happen than V て-form から, which has the same meaning
[Note] Also, unlike with the V て-form から, there is no implication that V1 or Noun is a precondition for V2
examples: 1) 新[あたら]しいのを 買[か]った あとで，なくした 時計[とけい]が 見[み]つかりました。
1) After I had bought a new one, the watch I had lost was found
2) 仕事[しごと]の あとで，飲[の]みに 行[い]きませんか。
2) Shall we go for a drink after work

explanations: This indicates that V1 is an action or state that accompanies V2
For example below state whether or not soy sauce is used when the action たべます is performed
V1 and V2 are actions performed by the same person
examples: 1) しょうゆを つけて たべます。
1) We eat it with soy sauce

topic: V1 ない-form ないで V2
explanations: This indicates that V1 is an action or state that accompanies V2
For example below state whether or not soy sauce is used when the action たべます is performed
V1 and V2 are actions performed by the same person
[Note] V1 ない-form ないで V2 can also be used to indicate a decision to perform one or other of two mutually-exclusive alternatives V1 and V2
examples: 1) しょうゆを つけないで たべます。
1) We eat it without soy sauce
2) 日曜日[にちようび]は どこも 行[い]かないで，うちで ゆっくり 休[やす]みます。
2) I'm not going anywhere on Sunday, I'm going to stay at home and take it easy
